properties.Name: Caramel Boutique Hotel
properties.description: I stayed at the Caramel Boutique Hotel in Hamra. The employees here are helpful and friendly! My room was spacious and comfortable. Even though the hotel is in a central area near several bars, I thought the room was quiet. Attached to the hotel is the amazing Propaganda Gin Bar.

properties.Name: T-Marbouta
properties.description: A group went to T-Marbouta after the conference reception. It was a great environment with nice Lebanese mezze.

properties.Name: American University of Beirut
properties.description: The event I attended was held at the American University Beirut. The class I took is where I learned more about working with Leaflet and was inspired to make these maps! AUB's Campus is beautiful, set on the side of the hill overlooking the Mediterranean. There was fantastic flora and so many cats.

properties.Name: Dwell
properties.description: Dwell is a cool coffee shop on campus that promotes zero-waste principles and methods. I really enjoyed the coffee, salads, and outdoor seating area.

properties.Name: Orient Institut Beirut
properties.description: The event had a reception at the Orient-Institut Beirut. After a presentation in the library, wine and hors d'oeuvres were served in the garden.

properties.Name: Barbar
properties.description: Barbar is a popular street food place, and I went for falafel a couple times.

properties.Name: Bedivere Eatery and Tavern
properties.description: The first night several people went to Bedivere, a bar in Hamra. Hamra is known for its bars, and all of the ones I visited, including Bedivere, had great ambience.

properties.Name: Ferdinand
properties.description: Ferdinand is a classy cocktail bar in Hamra. Their drink list is impressive, and all the cocktails are well crafted. Good food is served, too!

properties.Name: Pool D'état
properties.description: Pool d'etat is a rooftop bar with a pool! Unfortunately, I did not bring my swimsuit with me when I went.
